Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2017 02:02PM - edited Jul 7, 2017 02:12PM by PNWskier Lumpectomy with sentinel node removal and port removal 2 days ago. I was originally going to have a mastectomy but the presurgery chemo (4 months) brought me into the lumpectomy range. I am fairly sore with trouble bending over and lifting my arm. I removed the ace wraps and showered last night. It looks pretty good, I don't see any large bruising or bleeding. The sports bra helps a lot. I finally took a narcotic pain pill since the pain woke me up last night but I generally don't mind being really sore if I can avoid the narcotics. The sentinel node was clear in surgery and I will get the pathology report in about a week and a half with my follow up appointment. I am also looking forward to seeing how much cancer is left in the tumor that was removed. Two other smaller tumors disappeared on MRI after 3 months of chemo so the surgeon took a "generous" lump to try to include that area as well. I may need oral chemo in addition to radiation if there are enough cancer cells remaining.
Posts.Title: July 2017 Surgery kae_md99 53nancy

Posts.Content: Jan 23, 2017 09:26AM PNWskier wrote: Kae_md99, it sounds like a difficult situation with your kids. I believe that the right answers will come at the right time. I am a nurse too and work in a surgical setting so I see a lot of people in and out with breast cancer issues. I worked in ED for 33 years and I saw many people in extreme situations with their cancer diagnoses which was more difficult. It's hard waiting to put the pieces of the puzzle together for right now but I know it will come.
Posts.Title: Just got the call from my doctor and she told me I have cancer GAGA615 msphil

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2017 09:58PM PNWskier wrote: Just waiting. The MRI is done and shows about a 2.5 cm tumor and probably another small tumor in the same general area. It didn't see anything in the other breast. For some reason I was fairly emotional after the MRI. My hubby and youngest daughter waited with me and it was nice to know they were there. I went straight to work after the MRI and started with a break so I could get my day going! The path report is a triple neg tumor. I see the surgeon Monday. I have been reviewing a lot of information posted here. Thanks!
Posts.Title: New diagnosis - thank you all for being here! PNWskier claireinaz

Posts.Content: Jan 22, 2017 11:40PM PNWskier wrote: Hi to you GAGA, Carolbee and EastcoastTS! I'm right here with you, just diagnosed and I don't know where it is going yet. Hugs coming your way.
Posts.Title: Just got the call from my doctor and she told me I have cancer GAGA615 msphil

Posts.Content: PNWskier wrote: Hi all, I'm just starting to explore my support options and this looks like a great place. I also just received a diagnosis last week. It took a month of mammogram, then another mammogram with different views and ultrasound (which the radiologist could still not decide anything) and then a biopsy with another 3D mammogram. Each time I went in things got a little shakier for me. The path report is a little depressing and shocking, IDC with a high score. I still don't know what the lesion looks like, there is an MRI scheduled this week. They can't see where the lesion is right now, except for a little distortion-maybe as much as 4 cm. The radiologist says he would never have seen this whisper of an infiltration if I hadn't requested a 3D mammogram initially and I can't feel a lump or see a change in my breast. My immediate family knows the news and we are just waiting to see where this is going to go. (My youngest is 27) I have an appointment with a breast surgeon a few days after the MRI and I am hoping to start to get a feel for what I might be looking at and dealing with at that time. I'll be spending some time exploring what you have here and hoping that if I can't find something or I need to ask a silly question you can direct me. For now I am in the waiting mode and looking for ways to love the life I have. Thank you for being here! Dx 1/12/2017, IDC, Left, 2cm, Stage IA, Grade 2, 0/2 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 2/9/2017 AC + T (Taxol) Surgery 7/4/2017 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Sentinel Chemotherapy 1/9/2018 Xeloda (capecitabine) Radiation Therapy Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: New diagnosis - thank you all for being here! PNWskier claireinaz
